titleStmt.title: The Church of Englands old antithesis to new Arminianisme VVhere in 7. anti-Arminian orthodox tenents, are euidently proued; their 7. opposite Arminian (once popish and Pelagian) errors are manifestly disproued, to be the ancient, established, and vndoubted doctrine of the Church of England; by the concurrent testimony of the seuerall records and writers of our Church, from the beginning of her reformation, to this present. By William Prynne Gent. Hospitij Lincolniensis.
titleStmt.author: Prynne, William, 1600-1669.

titleStmt.title: The Church of Englands old antithesis to new Arminianisme VVhere in 7. anti-Arminian orthodox tenents, are euidently proued; their 7. opposite Arminian (once popish and Pelagian) errors are manifestly disproued, to be the ancient, established, and vndoubted doctrine of the Church of England; by the concurrent testimony of the seuerall records and writers of our Church, from the beginning of her reformation, to this present. By William Prynne Gent. Hospitij Lincolniensis.
titleStmt.author: Prynne, William, 1600-1669.

publicationStmt.publisher: [Printed by Augustine Mathewes and Elizabeth Allde for Michael Sparke],

notesStmt.note: Printers' and bookseller's names from STC. Mathewes probably printed A⁴ a-c⁴ B-G⁴.
Probably issued with his "God, no impostor nor deluder" (STC 20460).
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
